tweets.tweet: The LilyPond Blog is up and running here! Anyone can follow and leave comments on the blog. To contribute, contact Janek Warchoł.
Adam Spiers has built a web site which uses LilyPond to dynamically generate images of chords and scales called Scale matcher.
Ben Lemon has created some LilyPond tutorials on YouTube. Read about them on his blog.
Server Acim, composer and professor of Composition and Conducting in İnönü University - Malatya, Turkey, wrote the Turkish Ebook "GNU/LilyPond, Özgür Bir Nota Yazma Programı".
Aurélien Bello, has re-orchestrated a 100-minute version of "Der Ring des Nibelungen" for children, being performed in Berlin on the 5th and 6th of April 2014. Click here for more details.

Urs Liska will give two lectures at a conference at Berne University on June 2 to 4 2014. One is about text based workflows and versioning, the other about LilyPond and LaTeX. Details available on the institute's website .
